subject: Sales
title: The Pitch That Created TED Talks
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Pitch That Created TED Talks.

hook.text: Wurman imagined a conference where brilliant ideas got just eighteen minutes each. TED was born.

buildup.text: The eighteen-minute cap forced speakers to distill complex ideas into their most essential form.

discovery.text: Research confirmed eighteen minutes is near the limit of sustained attention. The constraint was science.

twist.text: TED proved that limits improve communication. Fewer minutes forced speakers to think far more clearly.

climax.text: Every pitch benefits from the TED principle: set a hard time limit and the message automatically sharpens.

punchline.text: Time limits don't weaken pitches. They sharpen them.

quiz.question: Why did TED choose an eighteen-minute format?
options: Research showed it's near the limit of sustained attention
